title: @Meddler Galio rework
body: So, I wonder how large is rework of {{champion:3}}

replies.body:
Full VGU, so new model, animations, spell effects, sounds, voice, loading screen art, bio and gameplay.

In terms of kit changes I'd expect fairly significant kit changes (so more than say Ryze or Gangplank got). Too early to say yet exactly which skills we'll be keeping or replacing though.

If I had to recommend which ability to keep, I'd say it should be his ult. His ultimate is pretty unique to him as a champion.

I feel like he could use a dash in his kit somewhere though...

I think the ult's the strongest contender on the kit to be kept yeah. Despite that, don't want to promise anything, given he's still a fair way out and kit changes aren't figured out yet.

Whether or not a dash would be appropriate I think depends on a lot on what sort of role he's expected to play. Initiator tank (Vanguard)? Yep, dash could be reasonable. Defensive tanky (Warden)? Power should be put elsewhere. Some form of mage/tank hybrid still? Hard to say without knowing more about the details.

Hey Meddler, you know how, in Legend of the Poro King, the Poro King has a radius around him where if any snowballs from the enemy team enter it, the snowballs get redirected to the King and can't hit his allied players?

How feasible would it be to get something similar for Galio, where he redirects all ranged attacks in an area around him to himself, maybe with some kind of boost for each time he redirects magic damage?

Like, he could pop this projectile absorbing field and temporarily gain +20% movement speed and tenacity for each time he takes magic damage while his field is up, or maybe gains charges on a flight mechanic ala Aurelion Sol, where if he gets hit enough, his ult turns into a "take flight mode" where he flies forward at high speed and then ults on the second press of his R button instead. Since you guys are rightfully planning to keep his ult, it would allow him to be designed as a defensive or anti-siege/poke tank, while giving him something that helps him get to the enemy team so that he can utilize his ult.
Technically it should be pretty straight forward. Main concern would be that there's potentially a lot of overlap with Braum there, with that being his signature thing and a really clear niche.

There is some overlap, but I think the main different between the two would be--Braum is all about the peeling, while Galio is looking to turn things around into an engage.

So let's say, his ult is split into two components.

The first component is his normal ult, an AoE taunt.

The second component, one he gets by intercepting enough damage for his allies, gives him a sort of Zac-range "fly forward" mechanic with a second cast activating a stronger version of his normal ult that gives him CC immunity from the point that he starts his flight.

So, Galio would work a similar niche to Braum, but Braum is all about damage reduction, peeling, and stopping enemy engages, while Galio is more about self-sacrifice. Taking damage in his allies' stead empowers him to strike back, and his ult is literally "HEY EVERYONE HIT ME INSTEAD" (which it has always been) so it's quite a fitting thematic for him to absorb damage for others.

I also think you should rework his passive to something that reflects this. Maybe a bonus similar to Wukong, but where Wukong gets boosted resistances per nearby enemy because he wants to fight, Galio's passive gives him boosts per nearby ally because he wants to protect them. And then pass on his current passive by giving him MR scaling in his spells to reinforce the idea that he should want to be building anti-mage. Maybe his passive is some kind of health regen increased per nearby ally and increased by missing health to encourage him to sponge up damage without getting forced away? And then give his "redirect" spell a long cooldown so he's encouraged to use it only when he thinks the enemies are going all in, while their goal becomes to bait it out and otherwise to try and siege by hitting Galio's allies and NOT Galio himself.

And I think I'm rambling now. Sorry >_>

EDIT: That would be an interesting thing to give him for a passive: have his body stop skillshots that normally pass through enemy champions.

Braum's identy is "stand behind me" he himself is the shield (he just holds a door)

Galio projecting his shield at range opening up himself, that could be the distiction if you wanna play with simmilar effects.

Also if you keep the shield, please finally adress that issue, where "shield" effects (Windspeaker, Idol, Catalyst) don't work on resistance "shields" like Galio's and Annie's that don't have a HP value. 

Athene was galios core item and the changes would have been perfect for him if not for that limitation.

If you do consider giving him a new ult, turning his old ult into a basic ability  (though smaller & weaker, but with a much shorter cooldown & lower mana cost) is an option if you want to keep the old ult in some form. Just throwing this option out there.
Like I said, that's IF you're giving him a new ult but want to keep the old ult in some form because of how iconic it is for Galio. This also depends on whether or not his old ult fits with the new kit & thematic.
Agreed, shifting abilities between basics and ults can be a really useful tool on some updates.

His W is pretty amazing too Meddler! back in Season 2 I remember playing with some friends on twisted treeline and how I showed them the true power of Galio tank! one of my friends was Tryndamere and he couldn't believe that he wasn't able to 1v1 me!

I mean I know it's a very personal experience but that shield with that cooldown is AWESOME, not to mention healing off damage dealt to someone else is pretty unique as well, if anything it's his most interactive spell

... meh, actually healing off damage by a shield is very very messy. It is something controversial tactic-wise ( you mitigate damage to sustain yourself ) and is something that feels very bad for the enemy ( both because it is not very visible and because you can' t quantify on the moment how much it is worth dueling, so for the enemy is always an on press lose-lose scenario that has to be nerfed ) and marginally good for the player ( because it' s a mixed bag of resistance aniway).

Maybe they could keep it as a Sivir' s Spellshield like ability, but idk even in that case.

Considering that it doesn't actually "shield" per se, I think the ability isn't all that messy, it's literally like Braum's dash, it only gives a buff in Armor and MR to the target, the healing itself is on Galio alone so yeah the visuals are pretty confusing, but the skill itself is quite good and interactive.

As far as healing goes, that's the part akin to a shield and again, this is also present on Braum, he swallows a projectile and reduces its effectiveness in half though in Galio's case, he isn't getting damage reduction per se but he's getting healed by a flat amount that diminishes, this can be countered with grievous wounds unlike Braum's and the effect in fact can be broken super fast by a DoT.

Personally I feel like it's an awesome skill because it's very simple yet maleable with very strong moments but overall kind of weak.

A good change would be to give it a lifespan of 5 hits only instead of letting the resistances linger after the healing isn't happening anymore.

Unreal how you ask for more AD survivability items when AP itemization is horrible in comparison.  MAW (or did you forget that one), SCIMITAR to remove CC (how does mage remove CC?????)  GHOSTBLADE for increased movement speed, STERAKS for a big shield  and even side items that just PLAIN reduce overall damage like phantom dancer and don't forget lifesteal for sustain.   AP assassin has really one option, Zhonya's.  Mind you, it should be a melee only AP item and something with shields should be given to AP ranged instead.  Zhonya's is horribly abused on long range champions and thus the constant nerfs and suffering of melee AP (and why the melee AP go tanks instead of their squishy assassin builds).  AP assassins need MUCH better itemization to have them in a place where they don't require bursting their target 100 - 0 in sub .2 seconds or their AP burst builds are just not viable to kill anyone.

I propose a MELEE ONLY ITEM for AP that has AP, magic pen, armor and a small base shield that scales well with TOTAL AP to prevent ranged and tank abuse.
I like your idea a lot. Mêlée mages have no real unique itemization options as do melee ADs. I fully support this idea, just make sure the effect isn't too OP and abusable by the melee fizz and echos

the problem with having an ad stasis is that bruisers like vi and jarvan aswell as mobile adcs would be completely broken. Think about it, jarvan or gnar could engage on an entire team and the enter stasis to wait for their cc, escape to recharge. lucian and ez could enter stasis to kite an oponent afterwards with their dash and every single burst champ would be countered with an item purchase... IMO it would make the game less fun

Right but look at the combine price. Its a huge item investment. 

If they spend 4k or whatever on that item, instead of IE or triforce.... shouldnt they have the oppurtunity to dodge dmg for 1 second?

It would allow us to see really cool plays at the Korean level. Imagine a super defensive build with QSS and this item. The ADC would lack damage but be unkillable.

DO you think this is a problem? Them trading late game dmg for utlity?

not an expert of this, but if the combine cost is that high then people would not bother to buy  a defensive item when behind because  they can't afford it and when ahead there would  be more optimal choices.

Think of hourglass. Before when it was built out of large rod ever mage would get it because it was the best choice out there. Then after the nerf (increase in combine cost) mages were kicked out of the meta because their builds and gold requirements were just silly compared to ad champs. Now that the hourglass is a complete defensive/utility item it only fits certain builds and you take a hit to your damage output if you trade it for a rabbadons. On the other hand, now that rylas is so over tuned (great stats, utility and combine cost) everyone is buying that item and the meta revolves around it. The problem was that the new ap items (hex tech) are extremly gimicky and have weird build paths, so theyare only optimal on a handfull of champs.

You can apply that same logic to your proposed ad hourglass and see that a similar trend would happen. An item of that caliber would be either completly op or useless (come think of it that exact same thing happened to guisoos some patches ago; it went from mandatory to fun, useless fail in about 3 patches)

In most instances he is just bland honestly... for most people is nto fun to go in, land some damage with q every  7 seconds for a minute and then go back to base because you ran out of mana, it just isn't

Cho'gath (the other mid-lane tank) is a champ that has precisely the same play rate as Galio. Do you play Cho-gath there ?No, you find his lane gameplay equally plain . Additionally his basic  skills cooldowns are even higher than those of Galio.

But should every mid lane game be Leblanc, Fizz and Ahri ? (with the usual Yasuo & Zed perma bans)
Come on ! 
Galio is different. Is that a crime ?
Sure he has issue but all of them could be fixed(with a bit of work) without ruining his kit.  And if the interaction with Braum is fixed then he would be able to be played as a support as well.

Yes galio's kit does work, but its very one dimensional and doesn't offer much variaty gameplay wise.

His w is good, but neither he nor his opponent will change gameplay patterns based on it. Galio will use it as soon as he starts fighting and then it will go on cd. Look at other shields for example, morgana has to choose which target to protect from cc which provides significant gameplay choices for everyone else, naut offers extra damage (this shield is also meh but the all other 3 abilities and passive offer cc so this is ok), Sion can do damage with it so the enemy has to try to burst the shield down or run away, janna gets to boost someones damage/protect them at specific times. Galio by comparison 90% just serves as a stat boost on himself while fighting and occacionally can be used on an ally tank but that almost never happens.

The e is also very uninteractive. Yes it works, im not devating that. But take karma's shield by contrast. It feels way more powerfull and impactful than galios because the movement speed game is not constricted to a specific vector.  also i have no idea how you concluded I said most of his dmage came from his e haha

His q and ult are unique but the ult is very unreliable and ebcause it is so powerfull it has a long cd
Galio being different is not a crime, singed is different ant he is not getting a rework. Also come on, if you are telling me galio is not gated early game by mana costs then you haven't played him. You can´t compare morgana's and galio's mana costs because their mid lane play patterns are VERY distinct from each other. Mid lane morgana just spams w to push wave until roa and then waits for a gank. You and I know she is mostly played as a support where her Q and E have very high rewards and because of window of opporunity and having an adc to push wave for you have not to be used as often. So yea you are forgetting to take into account cd time in addition to comparing mana costs


Just a last thought, but having galio as a support is WAY sub optimal because he has no real peel and his passive is completely counter intuitive for that role because outside of a locket as a 3rd item you wont be building much mr. Not saying he can't be played support, just that froma competitive stand poitn there is no reason to. and if they "fixed" his interaction with braum, for consitency terms he would not be able to have his ult stopped by stuns, which balance wise might be too op since outside of really smart positioning there would be no counter to it.

Sorry man but in statistical, objective terms most people think galio is boring to play and Riot's approach to kaizen (continious improvement) prevents them from having assets on the game that make it  seem unfinished for a majority of the player base. YES! there should be more tanky champs in other lanes! that is what riot is trying to accomplish by reworking galio, make a feasible, fun to play mid tank laner.

TLDR: you are failing to see that by "fixing galio's small problems" he would become too op because of all the utility, tankiness and damage he would bring. Riot wants to make a long term change that allows to balance galio and make him fun to play for most people

I see him being a warden, but current galio's e totally disconnects from that view. They could make him a body guard that locks up people when engaged... but that would be too much of an overlap with zyra I think. he would need to be a lot more tanky/far less damage oriented to be differenciate himself enough imo
Yes. Yes he does. For starters everything except his ult and attack range is an artillery ranged ability.
And why is that a bad thing ?
Because it is very awkward to utilize. He has nothing to support him in melee when he needs to CS.

He has two long range damage spells and a very powerfull shield. All these are not enough for you to CS ?

And what do you mean by being "akward to utilize". There are tons of abilities that are "akward "and most of the time there is a  balance reason to back it up.

Sure!  I'll just keep blasting from a distance to CS!

Oh wait!  Here comes my jungler for a gank. Time to he-WHERE'S MY MANA?!

Galio has horrible mana issues and has very little reason to get into melee despite having one of the best melee range ults in the game while also being melee. 

I'm not saying he doesn't have an interesting kit, it's fine on paper. But paper is a flimsy thing that breaks apart when wet, so his abilities in practice do not work well.

If you are hitting the minions with your spells then you are playing Galio the wrong way.

You are supposed to spend your mana blasting  the mage that is in the lane with you. Not the minions !

Don't get me wrong. Galio definitely has some issues and they should be dealt with. 
But do you really think that wiping his whole kit is the solution ? 

Galio has one of the most unique kits in the game. He is the only tank champion that can play in the mid lane. He deals a fair amount of damage and all of his abilities resolve around the control of the battlefield. There's literally no other champion like him !

So why not just focus on fixing the issues that Galio suffers from?

His mana problems could be easily resolved by tweaking his mana costs. For example you could make his Q(Resolute Smite) have a flat mana cost (right now it increases per level) .

His ult interaction with champions like Braum could be easily fixed by changing the spell from a taunt type to a charm-like effect so the affected champs can no longer break the spell.

With some additional changes he could also be played as support in the bottom lane.
Cho gath can also play in the mid lane so ye haha. Also hitting the minions with spells is just necesary against a wave clear heavy champ
